item.title: Ticket #4656 (<--more--> precludes full feeds) created
item.dc:creator: RuddO
item.description:
Posts using <--more--> tag aren't fed as full text in feeds. Please, an option to ignore <--more--> in feeds as we use it to tease the readers in our front pages, but we want our feed readers to work properly.

Pretty please?

Thanks in advance ;-)

item.title: Ticket #4654 (permalink_single_rss needs a filter) updated
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description:
Owner, Status changed

Adding the filter is obviously a no brainer as for renaming - it is a published template tag so we would need to retain the old version in deprecated.php for a while.

I'm not sure the rename is worth it.

What does everyone else think?

item.title: Ticket #4229 (No trailing slash on root dir breaks posts_nav_link) reopened
item.dc:creator: scramsby
item.description: I've hit this problem as well in the latest version of WPMU. This isn't the same issue as #1341. The problem is completely solved by removing the "$home_root = trailingslashit($home_root);" line like originally stated in the bug. Please investigate and fix this in the WP source code so I don't have to re-enter this fix into our code base each time we update WPMU. Please let me know if you need help seeing this issue. Thanks!

item.title: Ticket #4652 (Page and category trailing back-slash dependent on post permalink structure) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
Milestone changed

How does this relate to #3899 and #4554 (if at all)?

item.title: Ticket #4652 (Page and category trailing back-slash dependent on post permalink structure) updated
item.dc:creator: snakefoot
item.description:
Ok just discovered that user_trailingslashit has a nice filter also, much prettier plugin now: 

<?php
function fix_slash($string, $type) {
  global $wp_rewrite;
  if ($wp_rewrite->use_trailing_slashes==false && $type != 'single')
    return trailingslashit($string);
  return $string;
}
add_filter('user_trailingslashit', 'fix_slash', 66, 2 );
?>

item.title: Ticket #4652 (Page and category trailing back-slash dependent on post permalink structure) updated
item.dc:creator: snakefoot
item.description:
The wrong parantes ofcourse, hopefully the final fix now :) 

<?php
function fix_trailing_backslash() {
  global $wp_rewrite;
  $wp_rewrite->use_trailing_slashes = true;
}
function fix_trailing_backslash_post( $link ) {
  global $wp_rewrite;
  if (! (substr($wp_rewrite->permalink_structure, -1, 1) == '/') )
    return rtrim( $link, '/' );
  return $link;
}
add_action('init', 'fix_trailing_backslash');
add_filter('post_link', 'fix_trailing_backslash_post' );
?>

item.title: Ticket #4652 (Page and category trailing back-slash dependent on post permalink structure) updated
item.dc:creator: snakefoot
item.description:
Ofcourse I have to make an error in the plugin code :) 

<?php
function fix_trailing_backslash() {
  global $wp_rewrite;
  $wp_rewrite->use_trailing_slashes = true;
}
function fix_trailing_backslash_post( $link ) {
  global $wp_rewrite;
  if (!substr($wp_rewrite->permalink_structure, -1, 1) == '/' )
    return rtrim( $link, '/' );
  return $link;
}
add_action('init', 'fix_trailing_backslash');
add_filter('post_link', 'fix_trailing_backslash_post' );
?>

item.title: Ticket #4652 (Page and category trailing back-slash dependent on post permalink structure) created
item.dc:creator: snakefoot
item.description:
If specifying a post permalink structure like this:

/article/%postname%.html

Then WP_Rewrite will discover that there is no ending back-slash and will set use_trailing_slashes to false.

Whenever creating links to categories og pages then it will now remove the ending back-slash.

This changes all category and page links when upgrading from 2.0 to 2.2, with duplicate content to follow.

The quick patch to this problem is to create a plugin with the following lines: 

<?php
function fix_trailing_backslash() {
  global $wp_rewrite;
  $wp_rewrite->use_trailing_slashes = true;
}
function fix_trailing_backslash_post( $link ) {
  global $wp_rewrite;
  if (!substr($wp_rewrite->permalink_structure, -1, 1) == '/' ))
    return rtrim( $link, '/' );
  return $link;
}
add_action('init', 'fix_trailing_backslash');
add_filter('post_link', 'fix_trailing_backslash_post' );
?>
